Token.Abstract:
@class NSFNanoSearch * A unit that provides an API to retrieve data from the document store. * * The search can be conducted in two ways: programatically via setters or by providing a SQL statement. In both cases, * it's necessary to indicate which object type should be returned. The type \link Globals::NSFReturnType NSFReturnType \endlink provides two options: \link Globals::NSFReturnObjects NSFReturnObjects \endlink and \link Globals::NSFReturnKeys NSFReturnKeys \endlink. * * - \link Globals::NSFReturnObjects NSFReturnObjects \endlink will return a dictionary with the key of the NanoObject (key and the NanoObject itself (value. * - \link Globals::NSFReturnKeys NSFReturnKeys \endlink will return an array of NanoObjects. * * @par Some observations about retrieving data
* * Given the following data set: * * - Number of dictionaries: 3.956 * - Number of attributes: 593.862 * * The table describing different timings to perform a simple value search (i.e. 'Barcelona') is included below, ordered from fastest to slowest: * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Match typeSeconds
Equal to0.295
Begins with0.295
Contains1.295
Contains (insensitive)1.339
Ends with (insensitive)1.341
Ends with1.351
Equal to (insensitive)1.890
Begins with (insensitive)2.412
Greater than18.246
Less than27.677
* The document store used for searching.
* The document store used for searching.
* The set of attributes to be returned on matching objects.
* The set of attributes to be returned on matching objects.
* The key used for searching.
* The key used for searching.
* The attribute used for searching.
* The attribute used for searching.
* The value used for searching.
* The value used for searching.
* The comparison operator used for searching.
* The comparison operator used for searching.
* The list of NSFNanoExpression objects used for searching.
* The list of NSFNanoExpression objects used for searching.
* If set to YES, specifying NSFReturnKeys applies the DISTINCT function and groups the values.
* If set to YES, specifying NSFReturnKeys applies the DISTINCT function and groups the values.
* The SQL statement used for searching. Set when executeSQL: is invoked.
* The SQL statement used for searching. Set when executeSQL: is invoked.
* The sort holds an array of one or more sort descriptors of type \link NSFNanoSortDescriptor NSFNanoSortDescriptor \endlink.
* The sort holds an array of one or more sort descriptors of type \link NSFNanoSortDescriptor NSFNanoSortDescriptor \endlink.
* The filterClass allows to filter the results based on a specific object class.
* The filterClass allows to filter the results based on a specific object class.

* If an expression has an offset clause, then the first M rows are omitted from the result set returned by the search operation and the next N rows are returned, where M and N are the values that the offset and limit clauses evaluate to, respectively. Or, if the search would return less than M+N rows if it did not have a limit clause, then the first M rows are skipped and the remaining rows (if any) are returned.

* If an expression has an offset clause, then the first M rows are omitted from the result set returned by the search operation and the next N rows are returned, where M and N are the values that the offset and limit clauses evaluate to, respectively. Or, if the search would return less than M+N rows if it did not have a limit clause, then the first M rows are skipped and the remaining rows (if any) are returned.
* The limit clause is used to place an upper bound on the number of rows returned by a Search operation.
* The limit clause is used to place an upper bound on the number of rows returned by a Search operation.
* limit a Search to a particular bag.
* limit a Search to a particular bag.
Creates and returns a search element for a given document store.

Parameter.Name: theNanoStore
Parameter.Abstract: the document store where the search will be performed. Must not be nil.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An search element upon success, nil otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Initializes a newly allocated search element for a given document store.

Parameter.Name: theNanoStore
Parameter.Abstract: the document store where the search will be performed. Must not be nil.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An search element upon success, nil otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Performs a search using the values of the properties.

Parameter.Name: theReturnType
Parameter.Abstract: the type of object to be returned. Can be \link Globals::NSFReturnObjects NSFReturnObjects \endlink or \link Globals::NSFReturnKeys NSFReturnKeys \endlink.

Parameter.Name: outError
Parameter.Abstract: is used if an error occurs. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array is returned if: 1) the sort has been specified or 2) the return type is \link Globals::NSFReturnKeys NSFReturnKeys \endlink. Otherwise, a dictionary is returned.

Token.Abstract: Performs a search using the values of the properties before, on or after a given date.

Parameter.Name: theDateMatch
Parameter.Abstract: the type of date comparison. Can be \link Globals::NSFBeforeDate NSFBeforeDate \endlink, \link Globals::NSFOnDate NSFOnDate \endlink or \link Globals::NSFAfterDate NSFAfterDate \endlink.

Parameter.Name: theDate
Parameter.Abstract: the date to use as a pivot during the search.

Parameter.Name: theReturnType
Parameter.Abstract: the type of object to be returned. Can be \link Globals::NSFReturnObjects NSFReturnObjects \endlink or \link Globals::NSFReturnKeys NSFReturnKeys \endlink.

Parameter.Name: outError
Parameter.Abstract: is used if an error occurs. May be NULL.

ReturnValue.Abstract: If theReturnType is \link Globals::NSFReturnObjects NSFReturnObjects \endlink, a dictionary is returned. Otherwise, an array is returned.

Token.Abstract: Performs a search with a given SQL statement.

Parameter.Name: theSQLStatement
Parameter.Abstract: is the SQL statement to be executed. Must not be nil or an empty string.

Parameter.Name: theReturnType
Parameter.Abstract: the type of object to be returned. Can be \link Globals::NSFReturnObjects NSFReturnObjects \endlink or \link Globals::NSFReturnKeys NSFReturnKeys \endlink.

Parameter.Name: outError
Parameter.Abstract: is used if an error occurs. May be NULL.

Token.Abstract: Performs a search with a given SQL statement.

Parameter.Name: theSQLStatement
Parameter.Abstract: is the SQL statement to be executed. Must not be nil or an empty string.

Token.Abstract: Performs an analysis of the given SQL statement.

Parameter.Name: theSQLStatement
Parameter.Abstract: is the SQL statement to be analyzed. Must not be nil or an empty string.

Token.Abstract: Returns a string representation of the search.
Returns a JSON representation of the search.
